snippet: President Obama’s administration is debating whether the two leaders should try to work out their differences. Some fear a meeting would only play into Mr. Putin’s hands.
abstract: Pres Obama is considering meeting with Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin to discuss Syrian crisis while both are attending United Nations General Assembly; meeting could weaken Obama's efforts to isolate Russia in response to Putin's actions in Crimea, but coordinated effort with Russia may be necessary to address Syrian conflict; Putin has provided military aid to Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad, move Obama administration does not support.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s administration is debating whether the two leaders should try to work out their differences. Some fear a meeting would only play into Mr. Putin’s hands.

headline.main: Obama Weighing Talks With Putin on Syrian Crisis
headline.print_headline: Obama Considers Talks With Putin on Syrian Crisis

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
